text: George Robinson Swift (December 19, 1887 – September 10, 1972) was a U.S. senator from the state of Alabama. He was appointed to fill the term left by the death of John H. Bankhead, II and served in the Senate from June 15 to November 5, 1946, when a successor, John J. Sparkman, was elected. Swift was in the lumber business. He served in the Alabama House of Representatives 1931-1935 and the Alabama State Senate 1935-1939 and 1947–1951. ==External links== * Category:1887 births Category:1972 deaths Category:Members of the Alabama House of Representatives Category:Alabama state senators Category:United States senators from Alabama Category:Alabama Democrats Category:Democratic Party United States senators Category:20th-century American politicians
title: George R. Swift
